intro: Critoniopsis popayanensis, commonly known as the Popayán spurge, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in the Andean region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
